entry.meaning: "posterior, one after the other" (comparative of apa)
"(ratu Aiβisrūϑrima) Aibigaiia, of the night, of singing"
"the one who obtains the best" (sup. of *aiβi.nasaṇt)
"(ratu) Aiβisrūϑrima (Aibigaiia), of the night, of hearing"
"with right to acquistion of the (other) existence"

entry.notes: Skjaervo, 2013 discusses the bibliography on the possible meanings: "unsullied" or "unrestrained".

entry.meaning: "of the interlunation (day 1st-7th of the lunar cycle)"
"unshakable" (mid. pres. part. of the vb. *muiia- "to move")

entry.notes: Bartholomae, gen. sg. (thematized) of ayah- "iron", but Pirart, 2004 p. 257 gen. sg. of an adj. āiiaŋha- (ved. āyasá-). Kellens, 2007 p. 89 (sec. Pirart) "en métal > chaîne". For āiia- aiia- vid. De Vaan, 2003 p. 118 ff.

entry.meaning: "of such magnitude, of such a size"

entry.notes: On the meaning "tribe", vid. Benveniste, 1932 pp. 121ff.

entry.meaning: "who best recites the texts" (sup. of aršuuacah-)
"not to throw down" (neg. form of the PPP. of vb. star- "throw down")

entry.notes: Bartholomae as tatpuruṣa (sust.): "Ratav des Aṣ̌a". Kellens as bahuvrīhi "qui suive le cursus de l'Agencement".

entry.meaning: "holding the Order, supporter of the Order"

entry.notes: The difference in the quantity in -uuāz- (aṣ̌auuāzō) / -uuaz- (aṣ̌auuazaŋhō) should be related to the stress in the penultime syllable, cf. e.g. caϑβārō vs. caϑβarasca. Yt13.117 daēnāuuā̌zaŋhō attested with both. Vid. Insler, 1996 with bibliography. De Vaan, 2003, p. 152 suggests an analogy with the frequent aṣ̌auua, based on some attestattions aṣ̌auua.zaŋhō. Cf. RV8.6.2. r̥tasya vāhasā), vid. Pirart, 2004, p. 261.

entry.meaning: "(a person) coming to the nation/country, inside the nation/country"

stem.meaning: "to long for, to desire, to ask for"

entry.meaning: "what is most usually said" (sup. of uxδa-)

notes.bibl: Kellens, 1974 p. 93, n. 2 on the meaning of the word.

entry.meaning: "(a person) leaving the nation/country, out of the nation/country"

stem.meaning: "to cut up, to shape, to produce"

entry.notes: cf. the stem gaōdāiiu-, acc.sg. gaōdāiium/gaōdāim

entry.meaning: "the one who works the pastures best" (sup. of gauuāstriiāuuarš-)
"song of praise" (with nmāna- "house of the song of praise" = "Paradaise")

stem.meaning: "to teach that something (Acc.) is prior to something (Dat.)" (meaning vid. Kellens, 2010, p. 38)

entry.meaning: "the one that goes the furthest" (sup. of ǰaγmūš-)
"who accompanies the Daēvas, who accompanies the demons"
"created by the Daēvas, created by the demons"
Meaning uncertain, proposed "keeping death away, burning badly, dūraoša"
entry.notes: The word is problematic. Two are the proposed ethymologies (see Pirart, 2004, Kellens, 2007): dūra ("far") and aōša- ("decline, death"), but it should be **dūrāuša-; and duš° ("badly") and aōša-, however the quantity of ū/u is problematic and it should be supposed a dissimilation and a rotacism of the first sibilant. The first seems more plausible.

entry.meaning: "the most cheater, deceiver" (sup. of draōga- and drug-)
"where everything with Aṣ̌a as origin last"
"with three heads" (kamərəδa as head of daēvic creatures)
"that are around the hāuuani, around the haōma-pressing time"
"of the plenilunium (day 15th-21st of the lunar cycle)"
"producing hordes of men for many years"

stem.meaning: "to move away, to separate, to disperse"

entry.notes: Bartholomae: abbreviated form in the sequence frafšu[tā] ⁺frāuuīratāca, vs. Geldner frafšu frāuuīra tāca.

entry.meaning: "pushing the men and heroes to the front"

entry.notes: AIW: sust., but cf. ahunəm vairīm frasraōϑrəm

entry.meaning: "that increases all the good things for the life"
"the formula of the conqueror of the cattle, NP. "Fšūšō Mąϑra"
NP. Nairiiōsaŋha (irr. with the two members of the compositum separated and the first member declined)
NP. Nairiiōsaŋha (irr. with the two members of the compositum separated and the first member declined)
"that causes the equipments to be down"
"house", after garō "house of the song of praise" = "Paradise"

entry.notes: Kellens, 2010 p. 110 "matronymique de *mazī- "la grande (terre)". Bartholomae "aus Māzana stammend" as demonym.

entry.meaning: "proper of those performing sacrifices to Mazdā"

entry.notes: The OAv. form attested with middle dot and long ā mązā.raiiā, while YAv. mązaraiia. Attestations in YAv. (Y27.7, VrS31.11) problematic.

entry.meaning: "the first one to take up the position"
"when; so that, in order to, that"
first part of compound particle, to chain parts of a sentence, e.g. yat̰ vā"being ... being..."
"the election with wich" (univerbation of yā varəna-)
second part of compound particle, to chain parts of a sentece, e.g. yat̰ vā "being... being..."

entry.notes: Without ń in all forms. Vid. Cantera, 2021b p. 75.

entry.meaning: "relative to the fields / pastures", as sust. "farmer, breeder"
"who /that brings it better, who / that conducts it better" (sup. of vāzah-); (Fire) Vāzišta
"who is more able to break the obstacle" (comp. of vərəϑrā̌jan-)
"taking into account the pauses (during the recitation)"
"who knows the profession of faith (i.e. the Frauuarāne)"
"of the gibbous phase (day 8th-14th and 22nd-28th of the lunar cycle"

entry.notes: Meaning sec. Bartholomae (as well for Y10.11). Cf. meaning of viš.paϑa (Y10.11).

Lit. meaning maybe Kellens, 2007 p. 74 "path of the birds" (cf. viš.paϑa), sec. Thieme (FS Turner, p. 158). Pirart, 2004. p. 335 "prosperity, exuberance" from spā "inflate, swell". Both Kellens and Pirart use these meanings for Y10.4.

entry.meaning: "according to the ratu, agreeing the ratu"
"(ratu) Rapiϑβina, of the noon, of the noonday"

stem.meaning: "to make quick, to make light, to urge"

entry.meaning: "the most straight, the most righteous" (sup. of ərəzu-)
"worthy of getting a praise" (that is, a text containing staōmi)
entry.notes: AIW: sust.but cf. aṣ̌əm vahištəm staōϑβəm

entry.meaning: "obtained by questioning for the sake of knowledge"
"of Zaraϑuštra, in the way of Zaraϑuštra"
"haōma" (juice of a plant, not certainly determined), NP. "Haōma"

stem.meaning: "to follow, to go hand in hand with"

entry.meaning: "alltogether, at the same time, together with"
"the one who conquers best" (sup. of haŋhanuua-)
"of better blessing, more magic" (comp. of humāiia-)
"Xᵛaniraϑa" (region in the middle of the Earth)
"the greatest holder of xᵛarənah, the most glorious"
